turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Sabotage (1936 film).
turn.2: Sabotage (1936 film)  Sabotage, also released as The Woman Alone, is a 1936 British espionage thriller film directed by Alfred Hitchcock and starring Sylvia Sidney, Oskar Homolka, and John Loder.
turn.3: What is the main difference between the film and the book?
turn.4: It is loosely based on Joseph Conrad's novel "The Secret Agent", about a woman who discovers that her husband, a London cinema owner, is a terrorist agent. "Sabotage" should not be confused with Hitchcock's film "Secret Agent", also released in 1936, but based on the stories of W. Somerset Maugham.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: Also should not be confused with Hitchcock's film "Saboteur" (1942) which includes the iconic fall from the torch of the Statue of Liberty which presaged the Mount Rushmore scene in "North by Northwest".
turn.8: The film holds a rare 100% rating on review aggregator website Rotten Tomatoes.
turn.10: In 2017 a poll of 150 actors, directors, writers, producers and critics for "Time Out" magazine saw "Sabotage" ranked the 44th best British film ever.
turn.11: What is the most important fact in this article?
turn.12: Suddenly, London goes dark and loses all of its electricity.
